Name: Red Snapper
Ingredients: 7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0Â°Brix)
7 drop Hot pepper sauce (red vinegar-based e.g. Tabasco)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Collins glass .
RIM glass with salt and pepper (moisten outside edge with lime or orange juice and dip into mix of salt and cracked black pepper).
ROLL (rotate shaker over and over, rather than shake) all ingredients with ice.
STRAIN into ice-filled glass. Use ice from freezer (rather than ice machine/chest) to fill glass to avoid unwanted dilution.
Review: Looks like a Bloody Mary , and tastes a lot like a Bloody Mary, but features gin's aromatic botanicals.
History: Today, the term Red Snapper means a Bloody Mary made with gin instead of vodka. However, the first known recipes, from the 1940s, describe a 50-50 blend of vodka and tomato juice, with spices, just like an early Bloody Mary: one book even states that the Red Snapper is identical to the Bloody Mary.
